name: B. Cells Not Under Attack
statement:
Vasya has the square chessboard of size and rooks. Initially the
chessboard is empty. Vasya will consequently put the rooks on the board
one after another.The cell of the field is under rook’s attack, if there
is at least one rook located in the same row or in the same column with
this cell. If there is a rook located in the cell, this cell is also
under attack.You are given the positions of the board where Vasya will
put rooks. For each rook you have to determine the number of cells which
are after Vasya puts it on the board.
